org.kawanfw.commons.api.server.util

Class SingleLineFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.Formatter
      • org.kawanfw.commons.util.SingleLineFormatterUtil
        • org.kawanfw.commons.api.server.util.SingleLineFormatter

  • public class SingleLineFormatter
extends org.kawanfw.commons.util.SingleLineFormatterUtil
    This Formatter is used by DefaultCommonsConfigurator.getLogger(). Works exactly as standard SimpleFormatter, but:
    • 1) date is in short format dd/MM/yyyy,
    • 2) each log output is contained in only one line,
    • 3) a constructor with a boolean allows to display class name without package name to reduce line length.
    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Nicolas de Pomereu

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleLineFormatter

        public SingleLineFormatter(boolean doDisplayPackageName)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        doDisplayPackageName - if true, full package name of class will be displayed when logging, else only simple class name will be displayed

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public String format(LogRecord record)
        Format the given LogRecord.
        Format like SimpleFormatter, but:
        • 1) date is in short format dd/MM/yyyy,
        • 2) each log output is contained in only one line.
        If class was instanced with new SingleLineFormatter(false), package names are not displayed.
        Overrides:
        format in class org.kawanfw.commons.util.SingleLineFormatterUtil
        Parameters:
        record - the log record to be formatted.
        Returns:
        a formatted log record
